guided_meditations.name: Grounding Meditation
guided_meditations.description: These meditations help you stay connected to your body and the present moment, especially when you feel overwhelmed by emotions. They focus on bringing your awareness back to the here and now.
guided_meditations.example: 5-Minute Grounding Meditation – Focuses on deep breathing, body awareness, and sensing the present moment to alleviate anxiety and stress.
benefits: Reduces feelings of dissociation or detachment
Helps regain mental clarity and focus

guided_meditations.name: Loving-Kindness Meditation (Metta)
guided_meditations.description: This meditation cultivates compassion for yourself and others. It can be a powerful practice when healing from trauma by encouraging self-compassion and forgiveness.
guided_meditations.example: Loving-Kindness Meditation for Healing – Begin by offering kindness and love toward yourself, then extend that compassion to others, including loved ones and those you may have conflicts with.
benefits: Strengthens feelings of connection with others
Reduces negative emotions like anger, resentment, and fear

guided_meditations.name: Body Scan Meditation
guided_meditations.description: This practice involves systematically scanning your body to notice areas of tension or discomfort. It's an excellent way to reconnect with your body and relax.
guided_meditations.example: Body Scan Relaxation – A guided practice where you mentally 'scan' each part of your body, from your toes to your head, relaxing each muscle group as you go.

journaling_prompts.prompt: What does my ideal healing process look like?
journaling_prompts.purpose: Helps you visualize the healing journey, focusing on what you need to heal and grow, giving clarity and direction.

journaling_prompts.prompt: Write a letter to your past self. What would you tell them now?
journaling_prompts.purpose: Encourages reflection and self-compassion, offering words of comfort and support to your past self as a way of processing unresolved trauma.

journaling_prompts.prompt: Describe a time when you felt safe and at peace. How can you recreate that feeling now?
journaling_prompts.purpose: Focuses on moments of emotional safety, which can help reframe your current experiences and guide you toward what brings peace.

journaling_prompts.prompt: What would it look like if I fully accepted myself, trauma and all?
journaling_prompts.purpose: Challenges self-judgment and encourages full self-acceptance, even when facing the complexities of trauma.

journaling_prompts.prompt: List five things that bring you joy and comfort. How can you incorporate more of these into your daily life?
journaling_prompts.purpose: Focuses on positive, nurturing actions that enhance emotional well-being. By listing joy-bringing activities, you can prioritize them in your routine.

journaling_prompts.prompt: What does resilience mean to me? When have I been resilient in the past?
journaling_prompts.purpose: Encourages self-reflection on personal strength and perseverance, helping you acknowledge your resilience and build confidence.

breathwork_techniques.name: Box Breathing
breathwork_techniques.description: This simple yet effective technique involves deep, controlled breathing. It helps to regulate the autonomic nervous system, calming the mind and body.
breathwork_techniques.steps: Inhale for 4 counts, hold for 4 counts, exhale for 4 counts, hold for 4 counts. Repeat this cycle for a few minutes.

breathwork_techniques.name: 4-7-8 Breathing
breathwork_techniques.description: A calming breathing pattern that promotes relaxation and can help reduce anxiety, especially before sleep.
breathwork_techniques.steps: Inhale through your nose for 4 counts, hold your breath for 7 counts, exhale through your mouth for 8 counts. Repeat several times.
benefits: Reduces the physiological effects of stress

affirmations.affirmation: I am safe in my body.
affirmations.purpose: This affirmation fosters a sense of safety and grounding, essential for those who have experienced trauma.

affirmations.affirmation: Healing is a journey, and I am on the path.
affirmations.purpose: Reminds you that healing is a process, and it’s okay to move at your own pace.

affirmations.affirmation: I have the strength to face what I’ve been through and move forward.
affirmations.purpose: Empowers you by acknowledging your inner strength and ability to overcome challenges.

affirmations.affirmation: I honor my emotions and give myself space to heal.
affirmations.purpose: Encourages emotional awareness and self-compassion, validating your feelings and the need for healing.

affirmations.affirmation: Every day I am growing stronger and more resilient.
affirmations.purpose: Focuses on progress and reinforces the idea that resilience and strength are cultivated over time.

self_compassion_practices.name: Compassionate Touch
self_compassion_practices.description: Physical self-soothing helps activate the parasympathetic nervous system, promoting calm and comfort.
self_compassion_practices.example: Place a hand on your heart or gently hug yourself to release tension and offer emotional support.

self_compassion_practices.name: Gentle Self-Talk
self_compassion_practices.description: Practice talking to yourself with kindness, just as you would to a loved one or friend who is struggling.
self_compassion_practices.example: When faced with a difficult situation, remind yourself, 'It’s okay to struggle. I’m doing my best.'

grounding_exercises.name: 5-4-3-2-1 Grounding
grounding_exercises.description: This exercise uses all five senses to bring you back to the present moment and ground yourself when you feel triggered.
grounding_exercises.example: List 5 things you can see, 4 things you can feel, 3 things you can hear, 2 things you can smell, and 1 thing you can taste.

grounding_exercises.name: Tactile Grounding
grounding_exercises.description: Holding an object with meaning to you can be an anchor when feeling overwhelmed. This technique uses touch to stabilize your emotions.
grounding_exercises.example: Hold a smooth stone or a fabric that brings comfort, paying attention to its texture, temperature, and weight.

movement_and_physical_care.name: Yoga
movement_and_physical_care.description: Trauma-sensitive yoga is designed to offer gentle movement and breathwork, with an emphasis on safety and body awareness.

movement_and_physical_care.name: Walking in Nature
movement_and_physical_care.description: Spending time in natural environments has been shown to reduce cortisol levels and enhance mood, providing healing energy.

movement_and_physical_care.name: Gentle Stretching
movement_and_physical_care.description: Gentle stretching can release built-up tension, promote physical relaxation, and improve circulation.

therapeutic_practices.name: Art Therapy
therapeutic_practices.description: Art therapy uses creativity to express emotions, process trauma, and foster emotional healing without needing to speak.
benefits: Helps express emotions that are difficult to verbalize

therapeutic_practices.name: Dance or Movement Therapy
therapeutic_practices.description: Through creative movement, this practice helps release emotional blockages, supporting physical and emotional healing.
benefits: Promotes emotional release and physical vitality

therapeutic_practices.name: Talk Therapy
therapeutic_practices.description: Talk therapies, such as EMDR, CBT, and somatic therapies, allow individuals to process trauma and emotional pain with professional guidance.

healthy_boundaries.name: Identify Your Limits
healthy_boundaries.description: Understanding your emotional and physical boundaries helps you recognize when something feels unsafe or overwhelming.
